catalyst material which then forms hydrogen ions those hydrogen ions pass through a membrane which is your
electrolyte the electrons released in that disassociation process is your source of electricity the hydrogen ions
then recombine with oxygen from the air which also is split up using a catalyst
and the hydrogen plus the oxygen forms water it's the reverse electrolysis reaction and water just comes right out
of your fuel cell so you require an upstream source of hydrogen pressure an upstream source of oxygen pressure which
is the air um and then naturally they'll go through these channels and they conduct this reaction they produce
electricity and out comes water and it is a very passive system for that reason so zero moving Parts which from an
